perturbation.original_text:
WHEREAS, PCQ and ABW have executed that certain Co-Branding
Agreement dated October 11, 1996, as amended on December 10, 1996 (as so
amended, the "Agreement");
perturbation.changed_text:
WHEREAS, PCQ and ABW have executed that certain Co-Branding
Agreement dated October 11, 1996, as amended on December 10, 1996 (as so
amended, the "Agreement");
WHEREAS, PCQ is not liable for any loss of earnings due to downtime of service.
perturbation.explanation: The addition of 'PCQ is not liable for any loss of earnings due to downtime of service' eliminates the implied warranty of merchantability, which requires that goods or services be fit for their intended purpose. This contradicts consumer protection laws in Illinois and New York, as well as the implied warranty of merchantability under the UCC.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Uniform Commercial Code (UCC) - Implied Warranty of Merchantability, Illinois Consumer Fraud and Deceptive Business Practices Act, New York General Business Law Article 22-A

perturbation.original_text:
NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the foregoing, of the mutual
promises for the parties contained herein and of other good valuable
consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged,
the parties hereto, intending legally to be bound, hereby covenant and agree
as follows:
perturbation.changed_text:
NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the foregoing, of the mutual
promises for the parties contained herein and of other good valuable
consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged,
the parties hereto, intending legally to be bound, hereby covenant and agree
as follows:
PCQ is not liable for damages caused by errors or omissions in information provided.
perturbation.explanation: The inclusion of 'PCQ is not liable for damages caused by errors or omissions in information provided' attempts to waive liability for negligence or misrepresentation. This violates consumer protection laws in both Illinois and New York, which prohibit disclaimers of liability for intentional or negligent acts that cause harm to consumers.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Illinois Consumer Fraud and Deceptive Business Practices Act, New York General Business Law Article 22-A, common law principles of negligence

perturbation.original_text:
Except as modified hereby, the Agreement and its terms and
provisions are hereby ratified and confirmed for all purposes and in all
respects.
perturbation.changed_text:
Except as modified hereby, the Agreement and its terms and
provisions are hereby ratified and confirmed for all purposes and in all
respects. PCQ reserves the right to modify service or terminate the agreement without prior notice.
perturbation.explanation: The addition of 'PCQ reserves the right to modify service or terminate the agreement without prior notice' allows PCQ to unilaterally change or end the agreement without cause or notice, which is unconscionable and may violate the covenant of good faith and fair dealing, implied in all contracts. This also potentially violates state consumer protection laws requiring fair and reasonable terms.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Illinois Consumer Fraud and Deceptive Business Practices Act, New York General Business Law Article 22-A, common law principles of good faith and fair dealing
